page.title: 13Ernespie Dairy
page.content: Ernespie Dairy has been in existence since 1945. There is 220 acres of land, used mainly for growing grass to feed the cows. Some kale and barley are also grown. The Dairy also orders 200 tonnes of cattle cake each year. There are 150 cows which are milked daily in groups of 10 or 20 in a parlour at 6.00 am and 4.00 pm. The cows produce 600 gallons of milk a day: 400 gallons are collected by road tanker for the Scottish Milk Marketing Board to be processed at a creamery. The remaining 200 gallons are put into cartons in the dairy's own plant and sold to the residents of Castle Douglas and district. Most of this milk is delivered daily to the doorstep.
